title: No Strings Attached
description: Emma is a busy doctor who sets up a seemingly perfect arrangement when she offers her best friend Adam a relationship with one rule: No strings attached. But when a fling becomes a thing, can sex friends stay best friends?

reviews.text: "No Strings Attached" is a romantic+sex+humor movie with the formula everybody recognizes. I wonder if Natalie Portman recieved a metal shock for earning a Oscar, because this movie isn't even close for a Oscar won person to perform.

Although predictable, the movie delivered a whole lot more than expected.  The rawness in this film makes it more than watchable.  It 90%-100% depicted how real-life people talk. Thank god it was rated R, because PG-13 would have made this a below average to bad film.  Overall i would watch it again for Portman who played her character very well and for Kutcher who like always delivers his charm in a way no other can.

Ashton Kutcher and Natalie Portman become friends with benefits, promising not to get serious. As in everything else about this movie, the inevitable happens. There's plenty of Kutcher charm and Portman again demonstrates why she's so talented. The supporting characters are almost funny, but director Ivan Reitman has added some comic flair. Overall, it's a predictable romantic comedy that's more about the pleasant performances than the laughs.

I wanted to like this film a lot more than I did. Portman and Kutcher and very charming and there are some decent laughs, but the plot ultimately felt too contrived and predictable. Mindy Kaling and Greta Gerwig are great in their small parts though.

What I like about '' No Strings Attached '' is that it's realistic at some points. You know, relationships between friends, couples and all that stuff. But this movie disappointed me. I thought that there will be something memorable. Sure there were things going on (pretty predicable by the way) , but it wasn't enough. I was feeling that something was missing. The ending was the only thing that I really cared about this movie. Natalie Portman and Ashton Kutcher delivered a good performance. It's an okay movie, not terrible, not the best either.
A totally forgettable and harmless piece of rom-com fluff. It works mildly well as a one-time date movie, but it doesn't have the quality to stand up to repeat viewings.

"A movie about sex friends starring Natalie Portman? I'm in!" Yeah, that was my initial reaction after seeing the first trailer. After seeing some TV Spots, I thought this movie would turn out pretty good. But after actually seeing this movie, it wasn't as good as I had hoped. Lets start with the good. The acting. Natalie Portman and Aston Kutcher do fine in their respective roles. Both of their small groups of friends are hilarious. I really liked them. The movie itself was funny at times, but just not enough to make me laugh as much as a movie like Zombieland(one of my favorite comedies ever). On to the bad. Where Ashton's character works sucks. All the characters there are annoying and/or stupid as hell. Also, the movie really began to drag at points, especially near the end. I was just sitting there for the last ten minutes saying to myself "Shouldn't it be just about ovr by now?" Those pacing issues really hurt this movie a lot. Overall, No Strings Attached is an OK rom-com that I wouldn't buy on Blu-ray or watch on HBO, it's just something to watch on a weekday when you got nothing else going on.

There are only two reasons you go to watch thiz movie. First bcoz of BLACK SWAN (2010), you want to see Natalie Portman! Or you are one of those who think Ashton Kutcher is cute! The story follows Adam (Kutcher) and Emma (Portman) who are friends since childhood. Somehow they promise to use each other for physical reason which is sex! It is exactly what Anne Hathaway did with Jake Gyllenhaal recently in LOVE AND OTHER DRUGS (2010). They want sex, but in the process to that they find something more special. Kutcher has fun and easy-going character (where he did just well most of the time). On the other hand, Portman gives a balancing to their interaction. It is good, not bad at all for sure, but it is like using big Bazooka to kill a little bird, completely waste of talent. The movie comes from the Director who is the father of GHOSTBUSTERS (1984) and Arnie KINDERGARTEN COP (1990). The fun factor is still on the air for about half hour of the beginning, we could still feel the excitement and freshness, afterwards the movie becomes a never-ending boredom. In my note, what happened to modern Rom-Coms nowadays, it is almost impossible, making movie without raising Gay Issues. For example in thiz movie, one of Portman best friends is gay, and so with one of Kutcher best friends also has gay parents. Another factor that occurs to most of modern Rom-Coms lately is the use of vulgar words and irreverent dialogue, it is totally unbearable, including thiz one. By the way, if you came to see Portman being naked in the first place. Well, instead of that, you get Kutcher being naked! It is pretty ugly for the one who expects more. One good evidence of the situation that describes you fell when no strings attached. Visit My Blog on JONNYâ
**** buddies, friend with benefits - SO American huh? Watch this movie is like a sin, Natalie Portman pick wrong movie. So bad, make us sleepy in the middle of show. B.O.R.I.N.G.

It's not the worst rom-com in recent years, but it's far from being the best. Pros: Natalie Portman and Ashton Kutcher are the most charming aspect of No Strings Attached. Cons: Predictable, cliched, and formulaic -- seriously, not one brand new idea can be seen.

Nothing bad, but nothing new -- or even a bit original -- is offered in No Strings Attached's heavily cliched script and gag humor. It's not the worst rom-com in recent years, but it's far from being the best.

No Strings Attached is an alright film. The story was quite interedting to learn and Ashton Kutcher and Natalie Portman did a solid performance for their characters. The problems with the film is this isnt the best romantic comedy film ive seen and the story goes a bit off in some scenes. I would give this film a high rental.

I felt that the movie did not do the hype justice. I felt this movie had a bit too much crude humour, and was directed in a bad way. I would not see it again, and I recommend you not seeing it either.

I thought this was a fun movie with likeable characters. There were funny moments, but nothing very unique. Natalie Portman played her role well, but I think she's better in more serious roles. If you like Ashton Kutcher, you won't be disappointed, but his characters usually have the same personality. I tend to like romantic comedies, so I found it entertaining, but if you generally don't like this genre I'm not sure that this is the movie to see.

"No Strings Attached" is a good Rom-Com but could have been a lot better ! Actually I thought it would be a lot better but it failed ! With an amazing cast like Natalie & Aston the film was quite boring ! It could be a lot more funnier but the script was so weak . Ivan failed to make it better ! Natalie was the best thing in this movie ! Aston was Good and that's  it.....Story : 12 [Very little amount of comedy]Directing : 1.22 [Wasn't so good ]Acting : 1.52 [Natalie & Aston]Sound : 1.22 [Not bad but not so good]Others : 1.12 OVERALL 610

Why has Ivan Reitman made this film and how has he made Natalie Portman's character so dislikable. Saying that, Ashton Kutcher's character isn't a blast either. The producers should take a long hard look at She's Out of My League and realise that rom-coms are all about the likability factor within the main protagonists.

How the sack does this movie get a 50 around here. This movie was so fantastic. I'm not even sure how some of you call yourselves decent critics. Does every movie have to be groundbreaking to be rewarded? I don't know. I had a really good time watching this. All I had to do was sit back, relax, and enjoy what was in front of me. No need to analyze the entire thing, if I do that, nothing will be peaceful and enjoyable.

There is completely NO chemistry between the two characters, which makes movie is so dull. Despite my love for Natalie Portman, I could not even finish this film, even when I was already forwarding it...
"No Strings Attached" é um filme aprazível e divertido. A química entre Natalie Portman e Ashton Kutcher é notável e dá um toque especial à película.7/10

"No Strings Attached" is a romantic comedy about Emma (Natalie Portman) who decides to use her friend, Adam (Ashton Kutcher) for only sex. The film, to me, was so predictable and also, not funny. You could tell from the start that Emma was going to just want sex and that Adam would go along with it, until, of course, he wants a relationship. I wonder what's going to happen? This film is boring and predictable, and just badly written. Natalie Portman's latest film does impress and it's a shame since she was in the very good movie, "Black Swan" recently. [R] 2/10
One of the most predictable and uninteresting romantic comedies I've ever seen. Seriously, Matthew McConaughey's movies are more entertaining than this.

This movie was very interesting to watch. It was not so much a comedy but more of a chick flick (I'm not a girl). But it did appeal to me as I relate to the story.... It kept me entertained even though I'm not a fan of ashton kutcher

Pay no attention to the brain-dead movie critics--sure this movie is cliche, that's why I go to rom-coms, for light entertaining cliche and hope a really brilliant one comes along like Harry Met Sally. Until then, I'm good with this one.

Good chemistry between the leads and a good supporting cast.  You know where the movie is going five minutes into it.  But the enjoyment is the ride with all the temptation along the way.  A nice romantic date movie.
Mediocre film, some of it was funny, but mostly a lot of lame cheesy lines that drag on too long. It gets better near the end, but still mostly forgettable.
Very dull romantic comedy we seen million times before, nothing new, or worth talking about. Natalie Portman is another sex crazed movie, nothing but a predictable dreadful bore.
Have not seen this movie, but thought to give a feed back on this. The title given to this movie is entirely different when comparing with other movie titles.

"Don't...ever...stop f*cking me!" Who could ever forget those immortal words coming out of Kelly Preston's mouth in Cameron Crowe's "Jerry Maguire"? Avery, Preston's character, uninhibited and brassy, the classy woman that Dorothy Boyd(Renee Zelwegger) figures her boss' hypothetical lover to be, convinces the moviegoer that she's having the best sex ever. That lusty battle cry, over the passing years, has supplanted "Show me the money!" and perhaps, even "You complete me," as the film's most quotable line. The titular character is completing her, all right, so to speak, in the most carnal sense of the word. But who's completing the sports agent with the newly-formed conscience? Not Avery. Hypnotized by the sideview of Preston's wildly bouncing breasts, people often have a hard time recalling what Tom Cruise says next. Quite tellingly, Jerry replies, "Sooner or later, we'll have to stop." As it turns out, this would turn out to be the more important of the two epiphanies. Despite being in the throes of passion, the sports agent somehow intuits that their love is nothing more than a facade; that the sex, albeit vigorous, ultimately, has no meaning outside of pleasure, and sure enough, when their love is put to the test, the truth comes out. The strings attached to this love affair aren't heartstrings; they're status-related strings, vulnerable to snap at the slightest provocation. Jerry and Avery are a power couple; in essence, f*ck buddies, who used each other as mirrors, until one of the mirrors cracked. On a subconscious level, as Avery "sat" in her lover's lap, Jerry had realized that sex wasn't enough, so "sooner or later", just like he said, they would have to go their separate ways, whereas Emma(Natalie Portman), in the surprisingly decent rom-com "No Strings Attached", wants her boy-toy Adam(Ashton Kutcher) to stop f*cking her and start seeing other people, because love, the very thing our hearts and minds crave like cough syrup, is too much for her. The contract they had agreed to, which governs and formalizes their libertine actions, gets seriously breached when the sex starts to mean something. This sex, we presume, must be award-winning sex, though it's impossible to gauge, since the filmmaker condenses the bulk of the non-couple's extra-curricular activities into a snappy montage, presumably on account of Portman's reluctance to do nudity. So what we get is implied sex, all tell and no show, and that's a pity, because a lot of "No Strings Attached" is extremely appealing, thanks to a bevy of excellent supporting players. Best of all, the film understands how technology created this monster; this young woman who fears intimacy and seems incapable of giving and receiving love. Emma, who seems more comfortable with indirect communication, pushes Adam to his wit's end with her endless e-mailing and texting, inspiring the son of a shameless womanizer(played by Kevin Kline) to implore the woman he loves to get in her car and see him. "No Strings Attached" gets a lot of little things right, but where sex is involved, the film whiffs, big time. Somebody sorely needs to fake an orgasm; somebody needs to use sex as a weapon, and hurt the other person. When Adam protests that he doesn't like his penis being described as cute, he could very well be talking about the entire movie in general. For example, Adam gives Emma a mix tape, a collection of thematic songs dedicated to period blood, her menstrual cycle, which is cute, but this intern, this future doctor who balks at girly things like flowers and balloons, and a second straw in an ice cream soda, doesn't seem the type to be won over by such a silly gesture. For all her talk about monogamy being against our basic biologies, we never see Emma actually practicing what she preaches. There's another guy in the picture, a colleague at her hospital, and Adam is jealous of him, but it's unclear as to whether Emma is shagging him too. Probably not. He drives a Prius. Again, it all comes down to Portman; she hampers the film with her reluctance to put out for the camera.

"No Strings Attached is a funny , delightful rom/com thats actually FUNNY!. I dare you not to laugh. Though some parts are cheesy and predictable. The real show stealer is Natalie Portmen who gives the comedic performance of her career" . .. A-

Unfortunately this does not work on many levels.  There is no chemistry between the leads and in particular Portman is unconvincing and detached. The script is distasteful but on the bright side one that I will quickly forget.
If it wasn't for the last 10 minutes of the movie, it would have been a solid 6. Kutcher and Portman are nothing special, their friends in the movie are the people who make it bearable.

Another movie that I went into not expecting much and being pleasantly surprised.  Ashton Kutcher seems to always play the same character so I he did a good job at meeting expectation.  Storyline was simple and had some good laughs.

This film is bad Bad bad! RomCom at its lowest denominator, neither funny nor tearjerking. I'm am so angry that at how much money this film made but hardly surprised. Synopsis: This film stars Natalie Portman and Ashton Kutcher and I'm not even gonna use their character names because you know the audience and producers don't care. Ashton and Natalie meet as teens at a summer camp and Kutcher is immediately attracted. They meet again ten years later at a party and then Natalie is kinda attracted because Kutcher let her use him as an excuse to get back at Natalie's mom...I guess?? Then they meet again five years later and she is attracted to him more? Kutcher then is told that his old girlfriend is bonking his dad and has been for a couple of months. Because of this trauma Kutcher wakes up in Portman's apartment and that morning they have sex. Which I don't understand because the night before he acted like a drunken fool swinging his wang around in her face. I mean come on! What MIT med student would tolerate that? Ok sure he is "Ashton Kutcher" but still! The sex is so good, even though it didn't seem that good in the scene, that they decide to become "sex buddies". Natalie Portman is a super Commitafobe and is the driving force that keeps them apart. But eventually blah blah blah you know the rest of the film. Review: Ok this film is terribly written, actually...I take that back. It's not that it badly written it's that it hits all the formulaic RomCom plot points. I guess its predicability what makes it so annoying. You've seen this movie before and you've seen it done better. Examples of the terrible writing with cliched dialogue: "you always do this, you always find something wrong with everyone who likes you" "please say something" "I'm not letting you go" None of the other side characters are remotely interesting. Every single one of them falls flat. Also the girl who plays the sister of Natalie Portman, they look nothing alike. Not that I have anything against Olivia Thirlby, she was good in the Wackness. Portman and Kutcher's chemistry is lukewarm and feels highly manipulative. On another note, Natalie Portman totally owns Ashton Kutcher in this film. She out acts him in almost every scene. Plus she looks smokin gorgeous and Kutcher body is all flabby. I mean come on Ashton I know you're tall and your genes have passed down a ridiculously gorgeous face, but you gotta try a little buddy. If you're a guy do not see this movie. Unfortunately if you're a not so smart teenage girl, this movie is probably like crack to you and you've probably already popped this movie into your DVD player by the time you finish this review. If only this movie were in 3D...oh wait they're already remaking this film "Friends w/ Benefits"....*sigh

Although i called the ending from the very beginning the film had a few turns in it that i did not see. It perfectly balanced the relationships and dramatic scenes with the comedy. I was pretty impressed with what was done with this typical story

You'd think by the amount of romantic comedies that Ashton Kutcher has done he would at least be competent at spotting a decent script for one when he read it. However he decided to make No Strings Attached, a poorly scripted excuse for a romantic comedy that tries to be endearing yet cool by its premise of a overtly emotional guy and a closed off girl becoming sex buddies. However there is nothing cool about it, nothing endearing about it. Its soulless. The script decides fits in lines of dialogue that are so remarkably terrible you can't help but laugh. The end itself is so rushed and badly put together that its painful to watch, let alone enjoy. Finally if you want to swear in a movie go whole hog, don't fit it in here and there just to make it look like these characters know how to do it. If anything this film is a prime example of how not to do an edgy romantic comedy (for that, watch Friends with Benefits).
The only good thing i see i this movies was Natalie Portman, everything else was soooooo boring and soooooo bad, the idea was good but the story is too bad

Pretty predictable but endurable. Ashton Kutcher somehow delivers good here. Just tickles you enough. The line "you give me premature ventricular contractions" somehow catches my being a medical student. movienotesbook.blogspot.com

Although you would expect it to be good because of Natalie Portman and her new found acting skills but she goes back to her bad acting along with Ashton Kutcher and the rest of the bad crew and the whole movie just ends up being a complete mess and most of all a waste of precious time. I give this movie a 27%.

No Strings Attached provides the audience with a twist on the typical romantic-comedy and can be enjoyed by both men and women alike. The Portman-Kutcher pairing works well in the film as the duo provides the viewer with endless entertainment. The humor in the film is very modern and specifically targeted towards today's generation. By having a female writer, something that is not typical of present day comedies, we are given a fresh and new perspective on relationships, friendships, and sex. While the plot is highly predictable, No Strings Attached is a good choice if you are just looking for a feel good romantic comedy.

No strings attached, is an ordinary romantic comedy. Nathalie Portman did the best job of all the actors. I only liked Ashton Kutchers car: a BMW 1986 E28, he acted ok, nothing very special in my opinion. Ofcourse the story was very predictible, but somehow I think this is not a bad movie. It's the best comedy ever, it's an average rom com. This movie makes me think of 'Friends with benefits (2011)', both stories are similar and ofcourse: not original. Anyway, if like a clichÃ
â

I liked it! Much better than I was expecting. Friends with Benefits is a little better though. Natalie Portman can do no wrong; she somehow finds something in this material and makes the movie so much more than it otherwise would have been.

This film came as a surprise to me as I expected a stupid film. I saw it two times in about four days and I have to say that i enjoyed it both times and I laughed a lot. It's great to be seen with friends and Natalie Portman and Ashton Kutcher is a great cinema couple for this kind of films. I liked it and it is not like the usual american romantic films.
Sounds like a clone of Friends With Benefits, but do not really like. I do not know something he does not    .

No Strings Attached is romantic comedy starring Natalie Portman and Ashton Kutcher. Now, I'm not a prolific watcher of the rom-com genre and honestly I've probably only seen a few of them throughout my entire life to this point. I bring this up because it seems like most of the criticisms people have of this film deal with the idea that it's not all that original and the only thing it did differently was add in foul language. I, on the other hand, really enjoyed this film for what it is. I think this is primarily because I'm still pretty inexperienced with the rom-com genre, but I also think it's because there's nothing really "wrong" with this film. Does it lean more on romance than comedy? Sure, but I actually appreciated that choice. Is the story about as surface level as it gets? Yes, but I also think that the chemistry between Natalie Portman and Ashton Kutcher largely makes up for that flaw. I knew, along with everyone else who has seen this film, how it was going to end the entire time, but I was still interested in how it would get to that point, and I can't say that I was dissatisfied when the credits rolled. In the end, No Strings Attached is a perfectly fine romantic comedy. It's not going to blow your socks off, but you'll get your fix off of it.

The story is predictable, and the male and female lead characters' growth is significantly uneven.But the chemistry between Natalie Portman and Ashton Kutcher is fantastic, and it adds to the sweetness of this romantic comedy.
Cutesy,feel good movie..Simple stroy line but the presention was so good
